definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Canada owns the longest coastline in the world.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大是世界上海岸線最長的國家。

sentences.english: Based on the fractal theory, the fractal dimension of Chinese coastline and its character are stu-died.
sentences.chinese: 根據分形理論，系統研究了中國海岸線分維及其性質。

sentences.english: Wind and water move these grains to many places along the shore.
sentences.chinese: 風浪又把這些沙粒沿着海岸線帶到許多地方。

sentences.english: The vast majority of the world's most active volcanoes are within a few tens of kilometres of the coast (see map).
sentences.chinese: 世界上絕大多數活火山都在海岸線幾十公里範圍之內。

sentences.english: Along the northern coast of this continent, there are many crags.
sentences.chinese: 沿該大陸的北海岸線上有許多峭壁。

sentences.english: The coastal lines of Aegean Sea are long and winding where scatters with many gulf and dotted with numerous and island.
sentences.chinese: 愛琴海的海岸線非常曲折，港灣衆多，島嶼星羅棋佈。

sentences.english: In the foreground are scenes visible over a rocky coastline toward the Southern Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 前景是一眼就能看見的南大洋布滿岩石羣的海岸線。

sentences.english: This process of longshore transport is responsible for moving sediment up and down coastlines.
sentences.chinese: 在沿岸運輸的過程中，沉澱物在海岸線上下移動。

sentences.english: The coastline is the base directrix divides the region of sea and land management.
sentences.chinese: 海岸線是劃分海洋與陸地管理區域的基準線。

sentences.english: Brilliantly green coastline reveals tree-house villas perched on a jungled hillside.
sentences.chinese: 出色的綠色海岸線發現山坡上蓊棲息的樹屋別墅。

sentences.english: Outside, a series of steps connects the cabin to a new boathouse and the shoreline.
sentences.chinese: 室外一系列的臺階將小屋與新的船屋和海岸線連接。

sentences.english: ThreatenedAn oil boom guards a small island in the Gulf near the coastline.
sentences.chinese: 油柵保護海灣中靠近海岸線的小島不受石油侵害。

sentences.english: The tsunami drew a line of white fury across the ocean, heading toward the shoreline.
sentences.chinese: 海嘯畫一條白線，狂怒地跨越海洋，衝向海岸線。

sentences.english: Landfall of the potential spill on the shorelines of Port Lincoln was estimated within 3 hours of spill.
sentences.chinese: 林肯港海岸線潛在溢油的登陸預計在3小時以內。

sentences.english: A plane came winging down towards the coast.
sentences.chinese: 一架飛機向海岸線低飛下來。

sentences.english: There used to be a greying tower alone on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 海岸線的那頭，曾有一座孤塔被灰色籠罩着。

definition: Binhai (place name)/Binhai New District, subprovincial district of Tianjin/Binhai county in Yancheng 鹽城|盐城[Yan2 cheng2], Jiangsu/fictitious city Binhai in political satire/Primorsky, a territory in the far east of Russia
